## 4. Example of an S4 method (mimicMethod)

```{r 4. Example of an S4 method (mimicMethod)}
mimicMethod <- function(x) {
  if (is(x, "matrix"))
    method1(x)
  if (is(x, "data.frame"))
    method2(x)
  if (is(x, "IRanges"))
    method3(x)
}

```

## 5. Look at the printout of as.data.frame

```{r 5. Look at the printout of as.data.frame}
as.data.frame

```

## 6. Base R printout of as.data.frame

```{r 6. Base R printout of as.data.frame}
base::as.data.frame
function (x, row.names = NULL, optional = FALSE, ...) 
{
  if (is.null(x)) 
    return(as.data.frame(list()))
  UseMethod("as.data.frame")
}

```

## 7. Using the showMethods function

```{r 7. Using the showMethods function}
showMethods("as.data.frame")

```

## 8. Displaying the function or method definition

```{r 8. Displaying the function or method definition}
getMethod("as.data.frame", "GenomicRanges")

```

## 9. Displaying the function or method definition (proper definition)

```{r 9. Displaying the function or method definition (proper definition)}
getMethod("as.data.frame", signature( x = "GenomicRanges"))

```
